etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Sydney Vines (1849–1934), botanist. From German Idioblast from Idio- + -blast

definitions: A plant cell having a distinctly different nature or contents from those of the surrounding tissue.
Hertwig's term for: a hypothetical unit of living protoplasm involved in heredity.
A mineral crystal within a metamorphic rock which has developed its own characteristic crystal faces.
